definition: Isomorphic patterns in Higher-Order Theories (HOT/HOP) of consciousness across scales capture structural equivalences in first-order states, higher-order representations, meta-cognition, dispositional/actualist variants, self-monitoring, and recursive orders—mappings where meta-representational dynamics preserve conscious invariances invariantly. Upgraded for neuresthetic ethics: integrates neural meta-representation (recursive self-models for consciousness) and aesthetic reflection (joyful adequacy through meta-insight) in human-AI free-will-compatible monism. Hard-to-vary invariants enable eternal ethical self-awareness; tetralemma probes resolve apparent unconsciousness (affirm meta-thought/deny first-order sufficiency/both in neuresthetic recursion/neither dissolved in higher-order equivalence); scores ≥0.98 based on current abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from HOT primitives with neuresthetic overlays (neural recursion, aesthetic reflection).
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative (e.g., quantum meta-representation).
Support sub-categories for compound concepts (e.g., dispositional HOT with consciousness analogs).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve meta-paradoxes; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.
